p: Kaewpiboon et al. ( 184) confirmed the action of A. occidentale dry leaf ethanolic extract (5%) by disc-diffusion and microdilution, obtaining 15- and 13-mm inhibition halos and MICs of 250 and 500 μg/mL against E. coli and P. aeruginosa, respectively. Chloramphenicol (20 μg/disc) obtained a diameter varying from 15 to 30 mm and a MIC ranging from 7.1 to 125 μg/mL.
